functions.name: Information Flow Enforcement
functions.description: Enforces the separation of information flows associated with defined types of data

subFunctions.name: Content Filtering
subFunctions.description: Inspects information as it traverses a cross-domain solution and determines if the information meets a predefined policy

subFunctions.name: Redundant Independent Filtering Mechanisms
subFunctions.description: Implements content filter that uses a different code base and supporting libraries and multiple, independent system processes

subFunctions.name: Linear Filter Pipelines
subFunctions.description: Enforces that filter processes are non-bypassable and always invoked

subFunctions.name: Filter Orchestration Engines
subFunctions.description: Coordinates the sequencing of activities in a content filtering process to ensure successful completion without errors

subFunctions.name: Failed Content Transfer Prevention
subFunctions.description: Prevents the transfer of failed content to the receiving domain

subFunctions.name: Process Requirements for Information Transfer
subFunctions.description: Ensures minimum complexity and functionality of processes transferring information between filter pipelines
